chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Criminal- Scheduling Order
Jury status hearing on March 22, 2023 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on May 11, 2023 at 08:30 am.

1:01 PM Defendant James Paul Adducci appeared by video.  Attorney Lucas Swank appeared by video for James Paul Adducci.  Prosecuting attorney Emily E Ruud appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advised needs to set 22CF98 for a two day trial. State has no objections. Defense requests 22CM42 track along. Dates to be determined via email with parties. Jury Status to be set approximately six weeks prior to trial. All motions, to include MIL, to be filed within thirty days from today's date (10-12-22). Standard scheduling order. Bond cont.
Envelope Bond was Mailed In- Bond Mailed to Defendant Using that Address

Defendant to have no contact with residence or office of J.S. Defendant to have no contact with office of Trempealeau County District Attorney. Defendant is prohibited from the grounds of Trempealeau County Courthouse. Defendant is to take prescribed medication within therapeutic range.  Court grants exception to allow Defendant to appear in person for any in person hearings in Trempealeau County if requested.

Defendant to have no contact with residence or office of J.S. Defendant to have no contact with office of Trempealeau County District Attorney. Defendant is prohibited from the grounds of Trempealeau County Courthouse. Defendant is to take prescribed medication within therapeutic range.  Court grants exception to allow Defendant to appear in person for any in person hearings in Trempealeau County if requested.
Atty Krueger advised Defendant waives reading of information and enters NG pleas.  STC set.  Bond amended.

2:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily E Ruud appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Paul Adducci appeared by video.  Attorney Rachel Ann Krueger appeared by video for James Paul Adducci. Def wishes to waive right to PH. Court advised def right to PH. Def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for further proceedings. Information filed. Atty Krueger states def waives reading of information and enters NG pleas to all counts. Defense requests bond modification to allow Defendant to appear in person for any in-person hearings in Trempealeau County and to lower cash bond amount.  Court grants exception to allow Defendant to appear in person for in person hearings if requested.  Court grants cash bond reduced to $2,500.  STC set. Bond to continue.
Status Conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status Conference on October 12, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Wavier
Notice of Completion of Representation
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and inspection

1:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Emily E Ruud appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Paul Adducci appeared by phone.  Attorney Rachel E. Pisors appeared by video for James Paul Adducci. Court advised defendant of max penalties/ rights. Defendant waives reading of complaint and enters NG pleas to misdemeanor count. Defendant KVI waives time limits to PH. Defense requests at least a month. PH to be by zoom. PH set. Bond cont.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Attorney Pisors request hearing on May 27, 2022 be rescheduled. Parties do not object. Court grants. Initial Appearance set for June 24, 2022 @ 1:45 PM.
Initial appearance on June 24, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

ADA Emily Ruud appeared by video for the State. Defendant appeared by video from TC jail with counsel Atty Pisors appearing by video. State makes bond argument. Defense makes bond argument. CBS. INIT set.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: 1:00pm Prosecuting attorney Emily E Ruud appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Paul Adducci appeared by video, in custody from TC Jail.  Atty Pisors appears by video. Defendant can see and hear okay.  Court recuses itself due to prosecutor within county Court oversees.  Bond hearing to be set with new judge.
Oath and Consent to Serve as Special Prosecutor
